item.title: GDocifyMd Pro
item.description: GDocifyMd Pro Get unlimited number of conversions for $1.99 a month, $6.99 for 6 months, or $10.99 a year. Please make sure you input the correct Google Account Email associated with your Google Docs Add-on usage in the following input before making the purchase! If within 5 minutes after payment you still are quota-limited, please contact 1919yuan+gdocifymd@gmail.com with your Google Account Email information. Choose a subscription length: 1 month - $1.

item.title: Markdown to Docs (GdocifyMd) Privacy Policy
item.description: Privacy Policy GdocifyMd (“we”, “our”, or “us”) understands that privacy is essential to the users of our products (“Users”, “you”). This policy describes the steps we take to maintain your privacy when you use our add-on (“Services”). By using our Services, you agree to the collection and use of information in accordance with this policy. Data Collection and Use Add-on Authorization Scopes How We Share Information Your Choices About Information EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) How to Contact Us Changes to Our Privacy Policy Data Collection and Use User Analytics Our Services use Google Analytics to capture anonymized usage information (“User Analytics”) Our Services only collect user email associated with the Google account using the GdocifyMd Add-On, for the purpose of rate-limiting free API calls to our server.

item.title: Markdown To Docs (GdocifyMd) Terms of Service
item.description: Terms of Service Thank you for using GdocifyMd. Please carefully review the terms outlined in this document before using the GdocifyMd Add-On (“Service”). This Terms of Service (“Agreement”) is a binding contract between you and GdocifyMd (“we”, “our”, or “us”). By accessing or using the Service, clicking “I Agree”, or by otherwise affirmatively stating your desire to use the Service, you signify that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by this Agreement and to the collection and use of your information as set forth in the GdocifyMd Add-On Privacy Policy.

item.title: Replace QNAP's SSL Certificate & Private Key programmatically
item.description: I’ve been trying to setting up DDNS for my QNAP NAS with SSL connection. I don’t want to use the QNAP Cloudlink DDNS service because I wanted to use QVPN service to globally gate all traffic going out from QNAP. And that disables the QNAP Cloudlink service from getting the real IP address for my NAS. The basic logic goes along this tutorial: How to set up a free dynamic hostname with SSL cert using Google Domains, except the following moving parts:

item.title: Deploy Nuxt to Firebase Functions and Hosting in Universal Mode (SSR) with Firebase Authentication and Firestore
item.description: The example repository is located at https://github.com/1919yuan/nuxt-firebase-example I’ve been volunteering in an NPO and learning webapp development recently. After procrastinating for a long time, I finally settled down on using Nuxt.js for developing the website for the NPO. Even though there are many resources on nuxtjs.org about deploying to different environments, there is not an official guide about deploying an universal mode Nuxt.js application to Firebase. This becomes more difficult when you want to leverage Firebase’s authentication and firestore service in universal mode.

item.title: Non-parametric Exponential Family Model with applications to ERGM
item.description: After leaving my first adventure in a robotics lab at Purdue, I did 2+ years research on machine learning. The result is two NIPS workshop papers, one proposing a non-parametric exponential family model and the other applies the model to social network analysis - exponential random graph models. The theory of non-parametric exponential family model is more interesting, and we later submitted an extended version of the paper to arXiv.

item.title: Augmented Lagrangian method on the Thomson problem
item.description: During the Spring 2012 semester, Nan Ding and I took the class CS590OPT together. The final project we did was on developing Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) and Augmented Lagrangian Method (ALM) and use it to solve the Thomson problem. Report | Code

item.title: Robust Semantic Place Recognition with Vocabulary Tree and Landmark Detection
item.description: This is my main project when I was working on Robotics at Purdue ECE. Place recognition with image time series, published at ASP-AVS-11 workshop. Paper | Slides | Video | BibTeX

item.title: Resources for USTCers
item.description: I graduated from University of Science and Technology of China in 2008, and then went to U.S. for graudate study. USTC has always held a special place in my heart. Here are some letter templates that I prepared during my graduate school application, and I hope they would still be useful to my fellow USTCers who are preparing to apply for graduate schools. Watermarked letter template in doc,latex formats USTCers please feel free to contact me at 1919yuan at gmail dot com anytime – I enjoyed my days at USTC so much, and I would like to do all I can to help make USTC a better place.
